  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40776].
  {panel}

h1. Steps to Reproduce
1. Setup confluence and jira on the same server
2. Setup Application links using http://myserver:8091/jira as Application URL but http://mycompany.com/jira  as Display URL
3. Create a Jira Chart Macro and choose Two Dimentional and any data and save
4. Observe the links in the table

h1. Expected Behaviour
Any number in the table should point to http://mycompany.com/jira

h1. Actual Behaviour
All the links point to http://myserver:8091/jira
fields.summary: Jira  Chart Two Dimentional: Links point to application url

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40773].
  {panel}

Currently, we are able to see the additional scrollbar at the bottom of the page with large table if only the page contain text that is longer than the table horizontal length as per screenshot below:
!test2.PNG|thumbnail!

However, the horizontal scrollbar will not appear if the page with large table does not contain text that is longer than the table horizontal length as per screenshot below:
!test2.PNG|thumbnail!

Therefore, it would be better if we could have the horizontal scrollbar to appear regardless if we have the longer text in the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40762].
  {panel}

All user must be able to read all pages of a space. 
Fine :) but there are so much pages.
There is no possibility to pre filtering a page list on users or groups. :(

We need a function to filtering the page view for the user macros pagetree, children and recently-updated.

The filtering should depends on a special group and user list per page (editable like the page permission dialog).

If a user is on the list (or a member of a group) defined at the special page list, the page is listed via the user macros.

If the user isn't on the special list the page isn't listed.
Page with no special list entry will be listed.

The function is adjustable by a boolean parameter in the user macros pagetree, children and recently-updated.
fields.summary: Filtering option for user macros pagetree, children and recently-updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40760].
  {panel}

Hi,

As a software developer whose main use of Confluence is to document my code and methods for reproducibility, I find myself in need of the following feature :

The ability to insert full links (http://server/contextpath/download/attachments/...) to attached files inside the code macro.

This would for example be very useful when writing bash commands that involve retrieving patches and additional files.

Thank you for considering this as a feature request.

Regards
fields.summary: Add ability to insert a full file link inside the code macro

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40757].

Hi,

We need an additional feature in task macro.

Right now it only shows these columns: description,duedate,assignee,location.
In order to be able to utilize this feature I would really need an additional column "statusupdates" - it should be editable in the task report display (just like the checkbox) and would be initially blank.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40756].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The "..." menu at the top right in the file preview that expands to show the "Edit" option for Microsoft Office documents when running Internet Explorer or Firefox doesn't show at all since Confluence 6.0.0-2016.06.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Load up Confluence with Firefox or IE.
# Embed a Word or Excel document in a page via Insert > File and Images.
# Click on the thumbnail to open that document in the file preview.

h3. Expected results
As well as the download, upload, share, and close icons at the top-right, there should be a "..." dropdown with "Edit" that allows the user to edit the document directly in Microsoft Office or OpenOffice (as per [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Office+Connector+Prerequisites]).

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-22 at 1.32.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
The "..." dropdown is totally missing regardless of browser.
fields.summary: "Edit" link missing in file preview for Microsoft Office documents

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40752].
  {panel}

We're running into issues where the wizard for creating a new page from a blueprint has become cumbersome due to the number of templates we have. Users must scroll once you have 6+ entries whcih is quite low considering the built-ins include 8+ entries.

Some desired improvements may include:
* Larger modal window size
* List options rather than big detailed options
* Top/Most Frequent/Favourited templates
* Recommended templates based on the parent page - eg 'Meeting Notes' page automatically suggests Meeting Notes template. -- Yes I know about the button to create based off a template :)

fields.description:
In order to fetch a previous version of a page using the Confluence REST API, you need to specify 'status=historical' in the query parameters. Although the "status" parameter is mentioned in the REST API docs, there is no where a list of the status values and what they mean. 

The REST API docs should really just list out the valid values for "status" and what they mean.

There is no way from reading the documents to guess that "status=historical" is needed when attempting to fetch a historical document. All the user gets is a "501 Not Implemented" error when this parameter is left out. Someone suggested (see link below) that in the past the error message in this case was more helpful than it is currently.

See: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35779624/is-fetching-of-previous-versions-of-a-wiki-page-really-not-implemented-in-the-confluence-api
fields.summary: Add documentation for "status" field in Confluence REST API docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40742].
  {panel}

Trying to incorporate a Google spreadsheet or Draw document into Confluence via the Widget connector results in no document being displayed and no error message.


Workaround for Spreadsheet and Google Draw:  
* Enable Confluence HTML Macros by going to Confluence Admin > Add-ons > Select All Add-ons > Search for 'HTML', and finally the second HTML module of the Confluence HTML Macro add-on. *(Important note:  Enabling these macros can make your Confluence site vulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks. Please only enable if you trust your users.*)
* Create a page and add the HTML macro
* Create an iframe, replacing the URL with the correct document.
* {code:java}
<iframe src="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dxSPZ07MJaD6HqAC8yqB-10xGWfYflnv1xZR3_fc38/edit?usp=sharing" noborder="0" width="95%" height="800" scrolling="yes" seamless></iframe>
{code}

Workaround for Google Draw Image
* Navigate to Google Drive
* Edit the Doc
* Under File choose: Publish to the web
* Publish the document
* Click the Share button
* Copy the URL
* Insert a new image and paste the URL
fields.summary: Widget Connector does not work with Google Spreadsheets or Draw documents on Confluence 5.9

fields.description:
Was having a heck of a time trying to get a command-line involving a pipe to work with the code macro. It kept cutting off everything before the pipe and wrecking the formatting.

I narrowed it down to a number, followed by 0 or more whitespace characters, followed by a pipe character:  '1|a' only displays the 'a', but 'n|a' is fine.

I've attached a screenshot showing the direct comparisons.
fields.summary: A number followed by a pipe character breaks the code macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40740].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the Page Properties Report macro will not show results if used with a Page Properties macro that has a Page Properties ID that begins with zero (0)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page in Confluence and add the *Page Properties* macro
# Add a table (at least 2 columns) inside the macro (remove the header row and add data in each section of the table)
# Edit the *Page Properties* macro to add a Page properties ID that begins with ‘0’ (ex. 007)
# Add a label to the page and save the page
# Create another page and add the *Page Properties Report* macro
#* Enter the label from the previous page in the Label section
#* Expand the *Options* section and enter the Page properties ID from the other page that begins with ‘0’
#* Save the page

h3. Expected Results

We would expect that the information from the page properties macro would generate in the page properties report macro.  We can even see the correct information in the preview of the Page Properties Report Macro, but it does not render once saved.

h3. Actual Results
No information renders and a message 'No Content Found' is displayed
 
h3. Notes
This issue appears to have began in version 5.8.16.  This was working in Confluence 5.8.5 and 5.8.15.  This is not working in 5.8.16, 5.8.17,5.9.1,5.9.4,6.5.1
fields.summary: The Page Properties Report macro shows no results if corresponding page properties ID begins with '0'

fields.description:
Confluence Server 5.9.4

Scenario: Use Include Page macro to duplicate a page which has a Table of Contents macro in it.

Result: The UL element class "toc-indentation" is being added to the ToC list, removing the left margin and consequently hiding the bullets. This is making ToCs more difficult to read, and more importantly the styles should NOT be affected by the simple act of using these two macros.

This does not appear to affect other bullet lists, nor does it affect the Children Display macro.
fields.summary: toc-indentation breaking Table of Contents macro styles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40738].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Backup created from Cloud instance cannot be restore if it contains audit logs


h3.Step to replicate:
# Ensure that there are entries in the [Audit log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/audit-log-802164269.html]. If there is no entries in the audit logs, try to make some modication to the user to create a few entries.
# Create a backup from Cloud
# Restore the backup to the latest OD version 6.0.0-OD-2016.06.1-0009

h3. Expected Result
The backup successfully restore.

h3. Observed Result
The backup fail to restored with error similar to the following:
{code}
2016-02-10 11:29:16,745 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.actions.ImportLongRunningTask] runInternal Failure during import
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/admin/restore-local-file.action | url: /longrunningtaskxml.action | traceId: a172a52c7cd939d9 | userName: admin | action: longrunningtaskxml
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: For input string: "2016-02-08 19:54:35.123"
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEntities(BackupImporter.java:400)
{code}
The issue seem to be cause by entries from {{auditrecord}} table. 

h3. Workaround 1
Manually delete all the object related to  {{com.atlassian.confluence.impl.audit}} package from the entities.xml in the backup

h3.Workaround 2
Create a support ticket in support.atlassian.com to request our Cloud Support Engineer to create a backup without the data from the following table since they have references against each other:
* audit_affected_object
* audit_changed_value
* auditrecord
fields.summary: Restore from Cloud fails with com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: For input string:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If we have modified/customized blueprints for a space and this space is exported then imported then the newly imported space will not have the modified blueprints which were present in the space.

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a test space and click the *** (3 dots) next to the create button
# The create pop up will appear and at the bottom there will be an option for *Add or customise templates for the selected space*
# After clicking this option we can see Blueprint templates which can be edited for this particular space.
# Edit any one Blueprint.
# Export the space (xml export)
# Import the space to a different instance or the same (First delete the existing test space)
# Again follow the steps 1 and 2 and check the edited Blueprint.

h3. Expected Results
The customized blueprint should be retained

h3. Actual Results
The Blueprint appears to be in the default condition (un-edited)
fields.summary: Modified content blueprints are not imported with a space import
automatic sorting of "meeting notes" into months/years

fields.description:
h3. Summary Non-breaking spaces: {code}   {code} are not encoded properly in Confluence REST API and is displayed as the character {{Â}} instead h3. *Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new Space
# Create a User Created Template from Space > *Space tools* > *Template* > *Create New Template*
# Create a Test page in the space and insert the *Create from template* macro and choose template created in step 2.
# Create a page by clicking on the "Create From Template" button - success
# Export the space to XML.
# Delete the Space.
# Import the Space into the same Confluence version.
# Rerun Content Index
# Create a page by clicking on the "Create From Template" button.

*Expected result*
A page with the user created template will be created.

*Actual Result*
The create window loading blank.

*Workaround*

*Notes*
The bug only persist when the User created template is created through  Space > *Space tools* > *Template* > *Create New Template*.   *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40729].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
This improvement request is related to bug [CONF-39539|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39539].
As of now, file conversion process for file preview will only be triggered once the user tried to preview the file. Depending on the document that needs to be converted itself, on the first attempt to preview the file, this feature then would not work correctly as the file conversion process has not been completed (users are only allowed to download the attached document).  

h3. Suggested Solution
To trigger the file conversion process when the file is attached to the page itself instead of on the first file preview attempt.

h3. Summary
Users in Firefox attempting to use Office Connector Plugin receive message:
{quote}Please configure the Office Connector plugin to allow authentication tokens in the URL path{quote}

In Cloud, users do not have {{sysadmin}} access, therefore, cannot update this setting.

h3. Environment
* Most recent stable release of Firefox (44 as of this ticket)
* WebDAV Launcher version 1.1.0
* Replicated with Windows 7 Pro, as well as 8.1 so far.
-- Confluence is 6.0.0-OD-2016.05.1-0005
-- Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.06.1-0009

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Locate an Office Document within Confluence and attempt to edit either from:
- Page Attachments > Edit in Office
- Clicking the "Edit Document" for an Embedded Office Doc
 
h3. Notes
- Perhaps was as of an update of WebDAV launcher 1.1.0
- Attempted the same with Open Office, but still receive an error
- One user has mentioned they can still use the feature but get the error.

h3.Workaround
- Browsers besides FireFox work fine
- Partial Workaround:
-- Edit the WebDav Launcher option within Firefox Extensions and delete the Application Path
-- This seems to allow the Office Doc to open, but not for subsequent edits. 

Note:

This fix for this issue is released in Confluence 5.9.7. However, if the customer still experiences this issue, please collect the following information,

- Confluence version
- Firefox version
- MS Office version. Microsoft Office 2010 SP2 or later should be installed in order to using this feature. Furthemore, please check whether Microsoft Lync is installed if Microsoft Office 2010 SP2 is used.
- the WebDAV Launcher configuration, the mapping from ext to the application path
do all users experience the same error?
fields.summary: In Firefox, using edit in Office feature results in authentication token error

h3. Summary
Confluence will attempt to start plugin  which have dependency  on another plugin which has been disable. The confluence should disable the plugin which it has dependency on another plugin that has been disable

h3. Step to reproduce:
# Disable the following plugin
#* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
#* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core
# The following plugin which it has depency on the plugins above   will be shown as disable in the manage add ons page
#* Confluence Hipchat Emoticons Plugin
#* Confluence Hipchat Integration Plugin
# Restart Confluence


h3. Expected result, all the plugin related 
The Confluence will not attempt to start the hipchat plugin 


h3. Observed Result
The Confluence is still trying to start the hipchat plugin which suppose to be disabled. This will slowdown the startup as it will attempt to start the plugin before timeout.
{code}
'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin' never resolved service '&hipChatLinkProvider' with filter '(objectClass=com.atlassian.plugins.hipchat.api.link.HipChatLinkProvider)'
2016-01-13 10:08:25,552 ERROR [Spring DM Context Creation Timer] [plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] onPluginContainerFailed Unable to start the plugin container for plugin 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin'
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextException: Application context initialization for 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin' has timed out waiting for (objectClass=com.atlassian.plugins.hipchat.api.link.HipChatLinkProvider)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.timeout(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:489)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.access$000(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$WatchDogTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:109)
	at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:555)
	at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:505)
2016-01-13 10:08:25,603 ERROR [Spring DM Context Creation Timer] [extender.internal.support.ExtenderConfiguration] onOsgiApplicationEvent Application context refresh failed (NonValidatingOsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml))
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextException: Application context initialization for 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin' has timed out waiting for (objectClass=com.atlassian.plugins.hipchat.api.link.HipChatLinkProvider)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.timeout(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:489)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.access$000(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$WatchDogTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:109)
	at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:555)
	at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:505)
2016-01-13 10:08:25,606 ERROR [Spring DM Context Creation Timer] [internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor] fail Unable to create application context for [com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin], unsatisfied dependencies: Dependency on [(objectClass=com.atlassian.plugins.hipchat.api.link.HipChatLinkProvider)] (from bean [&hipChatLinkProvider])
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextException: Application context initialization for 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin' has timed out waiting for (objectClass=com.atlassian.plugins.hipchat.api.link.HipChatLinkProvider)
{code}


h3. Workaround 
Disable all the hipchat plugin in the following order:
# Confluence Hipchat Emoticons Plugin
# Confluence Hipchat Integration Plugin
# Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
# Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core

Please note, you will need to disable the plugins in the following order else the plugin will be show as disable in the manage-add-ons however it is not save as disable in the database. Also note that removing the Add-Ons will cause Confluence to fall back to the default versions from installations.

Alternatively, upgrade all the Add-Ons to the latest version and leave active as this issue has also been resolved within the Add-ons.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User directories do not work as expected. Internal Confluence Directory and Internal Delegated LDAP directory are not treated as separate when adding a user manually to the Internal Delegated LDAP directory.

If a username (_USERA_) exists in the Confluence Internal directory, the same username cannot be manually added to the Internal Delegated LDAP directory unless the user in the Confluence Internal directory is deleted. In some cases accounts may not be deleted because they have created content. Disabling the account does not work either. When you attempt to manually add _USERA_ to the Internal Delegated LDAP directory, Confluence will display the "A user with this username already exists" error. The end result is that the LDAP user is unable to be added, and Confluence is not shadowing the accounts. The intended functionality is that the account should be able to be added. It is possible to add the account if the *Copy user on login* functionality is selected in the Internal Delegated LDAP directory settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add _USERA_ to Confluence Internal Directory
# Create an Internal Delegated LDAP directory
# *Do not* select "Copy user on login"
# Ensure the Internal Delegated LDAP directory is in the first position
# Attempt to add _USERA_ to the Internal Delegated LDAP directory (Note: _USERA_ is an existing valid LDAP user)
# Receive "A user with this username already exists" error message

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should allow the creation of _USERA_ in the Internal Delegated LDAP directory even if _USERA_ also exists in the Confluence Internal directory because they are separate directories. Confluence should then shadow the accounts and treat them as one profile because the usernames are the same.

Confluence should be querying the cwd_user table when checking for the duplicate username, but it appears it may be querying the user_mapping table instead. However, we were not able to confirm the queries being run with DEBUG logging on the crowd logs.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence will not allow the creation of _USERA_ even though the Internal Delegated LDAP directory is in the first position. Instead, Confluence displays "A user with this username already exists" error.

The same error is displayed even if you disable _USERA_ in the Confluence Internal directory.
 
h3. Notes
If we rename _USERA_ in the Internal Confluence directory to something else, ex: _USERA1_, Confluence then allows the _USERA_ to be added manually to the Internal Delegated LDAP directory, however then the accounts are not shadowed. If _USERA_ in the Confluence Internal directory had any user information, it would now be treated as a second account.

We were not able to confirm the queries being run as enabling DEBUG logging on:
com.atlassian.crowd.directory
com.atlassian.crowd.embedded
com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd

Only logged:
{code}
2016-02-05 17:59:44,443 DEBUG [http-nio-5814-exec-1] [confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdMembershipDao] isUserDirectMember checking direct membership for user [ admin ] and group [ confluence-administrators ]
{code}

h3.Workaround
To workaround this issue, you can use the "Copy user on login" function. Then when _USERA_ logs in with their LDAP credentials, it will automatically create the account without error, even though _USERA_ already exists in the Confluence Internal Directory.

# Go to *General Configuration* > *User Directories*
# Ensure your Internal Delegated LDAP directory is in the first position
# *Edit* the Internal Delegated LDAP 
# Check the *Copy users on Login* box
# Enter in your desired *Default Group Memberships* for the users who are able to successfully authenticate, such as *confluence-users*
# Select *Test Settings*
# Select *Save Settings*
# Have desired users log in, and an account will be created in the Internal Delegated LDAP directory, and will shadow the account from the Confluence Internal Directory
# If you would not like to continue automatically copying users on login, go back to the Internal Delegated LDAP settings and uncheck the box and test and save the settings
fields.summary: Cannot add user to Internal Delegated LDAP directory manually, if username already exists in the Confluence Internal Directory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence reported incorrect license count number on _License Details_ page after [disabling or enabling External User Directory's user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/delete-or-disable-users-138318.html] from Confluence UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Add an JIRA External Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-crowd-or-jira-for-user-management-229838465.html] in your Confluence instance.
(i) Please ensure to give this directory _Read/Write_ permission.
# [Create a group in your JIRA instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-groups-185729462.html#ManagingGroups-Addingagroup] specifically for your Confluence users, e.g. _confluence-users_ and add the users who can access your Confluence instance as members of this group.
# Access your Confluence instance and navigate to *Confluence Administration >> General Configuration >> [Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview#GlobalPermissionsOverview-Overviewoftheglobalpermissions]* under *Users and Security* section on the left hand of the page. 
# Ensure that you've given _Can-Use_ permission for this _confluence-users_ group and not _jira-users_ group. 
(i) _jira-users_ group is the default group where your newly created users would be assigned to should you create a new user in your JIRA instance. 
# Access the _License Details_ page in your Confluence instance and take note of the license count shown on the page.
# Navigate to *Confluence Administration page >> Users* and click on the user that *only* has access to your JIRA instance and not Confluence.
# Disable this user.
# Re-access the _License Details_ page in your Confluence and notice that the license count has been reduced by one. 
# Attempt to re-enabled back the user account that you've disabled in step 7.
# Re-access the _License Details_ page in your Confluence and notice that the license count has been increased by one. 

(i) Please refer to the attached screencast for further details.

h3. Environments
- Tested on Confluence 5.8.17 and 5.9.4 with JIRA External User Directory (JIRA 6.4.12).
- JIRA External Directory Permission's is set to _Read/Write_.
- The user account for the test *does not* have _Can-Use_ permission in Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence _License Details_ page is showing the correct number of license count. Enabling and disabling users from external user directory that does not have _Can-Use_ permission in Confluence should no be taken into account on the _License Details_ page.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence _License Details_ page is not showing the correct number of license count.

h3.Workaround
- Flush Confluence cache *after* disabling/enabling the user via *Confluence Administration page >> Cache Management >> _Flush All_*, OR
- Navigate to _License Details_ page and click _Refresh_ for the data to be re-fetched from the Database instead of using the cache.
fields.summary: Incorrect License Count on License Details Page

Documented at:

https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/search/v2/lucene/boosting/BoostingStrategy.html#boost(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader,%20com.atlassian.confluence.search.service.SearchQueryParameters,%20int,%20float)

Implementations of BoostingStrategy always see searchQueryParameters as null.

I did some tracing and found that it originated at null being passed into BoostingQuery in DefaultCQLSearchService:26 . [~slancashire] has some familiarity with this code.

I believe this bug was introduced with CQL.

Support request: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-167803

Steps to reproduce:

# Install searchboost.zip plugin to connie instance (it's just an example implementation of BoostingStrategy)
# Do basic confluence search
# Observe  searchQueryParameters is null when the Booster is invoked

We need to either update the documentation, remove the property, or update the code to create a searchQueryParams from the CQL.
fields.summary: searchQueryParameters argument is always null in BoostingStrategy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40682].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When creating a page based on a template that have variables, we need to enter the values for those variables. However, once we are able to enter text in the body of the created page, it's not possible the use the variables any longer.


h3. Case Scenario
# Create a template with variables $manager and $dueDate.
# Once I create a page based on this template, I enter "Eduardo Mallmann" for the $manager variable and "05-05-2016" for $dueDate.
# Now that I'm writing the body content of this page, instead of entering the name of my manager and the due date manually, I should be able to use the variables $manager and $dueDate.

*Example*
_Produce release notes $manager with the project due date $dueDate_
This would generate the following text:
_Produce release notes Eduardo Mallmann with the project due date 05-05-2016._
fields.summary: Option to Use Template Variables After Creating the Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40681].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When adding an image link in the site welcome message, the clickable are for the link spans the entire section, as opposed to just the image area.

h3. Environment
Tested in Confluence 5.8.17, and 5.9.4 (using the old dashboard)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to !https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/2041359/oZYNLidcDNI3S8o/Dashboard%20-%20Confluence%202015-05-13%2013-43-47.png! *-> General Configuration -> Global Templates and Blueprints*
# Edit the 'Default Welcome Message'
# Add an image to the editor, click on the image and click on 'Link'
# Enter any external/internal URL
# Go back to your dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The image can be clicked to take the user to the link

h3. Actual Results
The image is clickable but so is the entire width of the welcome message panel. In the image below, you can see that the entire area in the red box can be clicked and will take users to the URL:
!clickable.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
I have been unable to find a workaround so far. This can maybe be fixed through the global layout for the dashboard, or using custom CSS.
fields.summary: Image links broken in 'Welcome Message' layout

wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdlwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdlwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdlwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwdasdasdasdasdasdasdas;dkasjdlkjaskldjklasjdkljalsdjlsajdlkjasdlkjasldjlajsdlajldajskldjalsjdlasjldajsldjasldjlasjdlasjdlkajsldjalksdjklasjdlasjldjalskdjklasjdlasjdl
{noformat}

# Comment text is cut off based on window size instead of wrapping.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40675].
  {panel}

I am creating pages using the REST APIs POST to /rest/api/content filling them automatically with preliminary content. 

Before really releasing the page to the public I'd like to manually review it and tweak it. Only after that I want to release it.

However, when using the above mentioned REST API POST the page is available to the public immediately. All space watchers are informed and I have no chance to review it before releasing.

When doing it manually I can create the page and during editing I can restrict access to myself until the content is fixed and ready for release.     

I'd like to have a way to hand over the access restriction together with the call to create the page so that I can silently create a new page and watchers are not notified.
fields.summary: Create confluence page with access restriction using the REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40672].
  {panel}

Confluence File Preview does not allow setting custom size for SVG format

How to reproduce :

# Create a new page
# Upload .SVG image format
# Insert the .svg image using ! insert image macro 
# Resize image in a specific width using the custom setting option

h3. Actual behavior:
The image is broken or not showing properly

h3. Expected behavior:
The image should display with the custom size


h3. Workaround
Make the svg 301px large or bigger.  It only breaks for sizes below 301px.
fields.summary: Confluence File Preview does not allow setting custom size for SVG format

fields.description:
Update the bundled version of java to a version >= 1.8u71 (1.8 update 71), which fixes many security issues (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpujan2016-2367955.html#AppendixJAVA).
Included in the security fixes is a fix for CVE-2016-0483 "An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in the JPEG image format decoder in the AWT component in OpenJDK. A specially crafted JPEG image could cause a Java application to crash or, possibly execute arbitrary code. An untrusted Java application or applet could use this flaw to bypass Java sandbox restrictions".


Edit: updating to latest - 1.8.0_74
fields.summary: Update Java version bundled found in the installer to a version >= 1.8u71

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40665].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The upgrade task for Roadmap macro creates entry in Page history using the name of the original page creator even the user was disabled long time ago.

h3. Suggested Solution
There could be 3 workable solutions:
1. Don't make the logging regarding an update of the plugin.
2. Create a possibility to make a 'system' logging - that is a make that the system has made changes.
3. Log a system administrator as the changer.
fields.summary: [Roadmap macro] Upgrade task create the new entry in page history with the name of creator

fields.description:
h2.First Symptom

When adding rows to large tables, (in excessive of around 500 rows), there is a significant hang and often an unresponsive script error appears.

{code}
A script on this page may be busy, or it may have stopped responding. You can stop the script now, open the script in the debugger, or let the script continue.

Script: resource://gre/modules/commonj…nsion/data/mutation-summary.js:376
{code}


*Steps to replicate*
* Install a new confluence 5.8.16/5.9.4
* Create a page with 500 rows tables in Google Chrome
[^table-data.txt]
* Edit it Firefox, version 43

*Expected Behavior*

Edit without any problem, just like Chrome

*Actual Behavior*
!error.JPG|thumbnail!

It took 20sec for the edit page to show up


h3,Note

Observed if we tend to change certain row values the Chrome tab crashes. And auto saving drafts reports errors when trying to save.
fields.summary: Poor performance adding rows to large tables

fields.description:
We are using Confluence 5.9.3 and when an anonymous user tries to search when he is on the main page it will automatically redirect to the login form.

Steps to reproduce:
# Open incognito tab
# Visit http://my-xconfluence/
# Click into the search area at the right top
# (x) Redirect to {{/login.action?os_destination=/}}

I've also attached a screenshot which is visible for a split second before the page is reloading.

The issue does not occur when searching from a space (using the same toolbar search field) or on the field on any not found page e.g. {{/not-existing-site}}
fields.summary: Redirect to login when trying to search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40653].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence administrator, I would like for the Confluence profile picture size limit to be higher as most smartphones in present day will take pictures that are greater than 2000x2000px. This limitation seems to affect mobile users consistently.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Allow configuration of profile image size limit by administrators
# Increase the current size limit 

h3. Workaround 
Decrease the image size to less than 2000x2000px before re-uploading as a profile image.
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator, I would like for the Confluence profile picture size limit to be higher
